Comments_Questions: How clearly did the instructor define the topic of study
How clearly did the instructor outline the expectation for the course, classroom activity and homework
How well were individual class sessions prepared and presented
How well did lectures fit within the boundaries of the course
How available was the instructor for help outside the classroom
How useful were assignments in furthering an understanding of the topic
If tests were given, how fairly did they measure knowledge gained?
How useful was this course in preparing you for production work
How would you evaluate the instructor's knowledge of the material
Please offer additional comments on such topics as: what worked best about the course, suggested improvements, class materials, etc.
Comments_List: Even when directives changed, or work was added, Erich would go back and describe to us his expectation for our deliverables. There was never a question about what was due and when. He was also available to clarify and help with confusion.
I appreciated Erich keeping us updated when things changed as well, e.g. with quizzes.
As I alluded earlier, as long as he was not busy with outside contracts or show work for YSD itself, he was always willing and available to help with whatever I needed outside of class.

I already had a strong background and understanding in certain areas; however, where I'm weakest - dealing with software I'm unfamiliar with - I could tell the assignments are geared around making one feel comfortable with the absolute basics and instill a willingness to just dig around in a program. Both of these goals strike me as purposeful for an introduction course.
Watchout assignment was particularly great at this. I think the hands on stuff did more for me than some of the take home stuff in terms of systems.

I feel more comfortable in terms of hardware and software, but also just in talking to someone about projections. It was nice to also get to know Paddock a little better before working with him in a production capacity.
A good mix of lecture and practicum, with a focus on lecture. Organized, so we knew what to expect.
Thank you for a classroom environment that invited participation/discussion.
